isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Meritor Transfer Cases MTC-4208, -4210, and -4213 - Assembly - Front Output Shaft End Play Adjustment

svcproc.title: Front Output Shaft End Play Adjustment

note.para: Determine front output shaft bearing end play before final assembly. Seals should not be installed until end plays are set.

step1.para: Install the front output shaft yoke. Tighten yoke nut to 200 lb-ft (271 Nm).
Rotate the output shaft several times to seat the bearings.
Set up a dial indicator to check output shaft bearing end play. Center the dial indicator over the shaft using a ball bearing for accuracy (Figure 52).

figure.caption: Figure 52. Center Dial Indicator Over Shaft

step1.para: Use a pry bar to lift the yoke to obtain a measurement. To obtain a consistent and averaged reading, perform this operation two or three times. Record the reading for this shaft.

item.para:
If the end play reading is greater than 0.001- to 0.005-inch (0.025-0.127 mm):
Add shims to reduce end play.
If the end play reading is less than specification: Remove shims to increase end play. Bearing shims come in 0.003-, 0.005- and 0.010-inch (0.08, 0.13 and 0.25 mm) thicknesses.
If front output shaft bearing end play requires adjustment: Remove the front output shaft yoke so that the case and cover can be easily separated.

step1.para: Measure end play on the remaining shafts before splitting the case to make adjustments.

After performing front output shaft bearing end play measurement, separate the transfer case halves as necessary to adjust the shims and achieve the correct end play on the shaft requiring adjustment.
Adjust the shims to achieve the correct bearing end play on all shafts as required. Refer to Shim Assembly in this section.
